nl.inl.blacklab.search.results

Class DocResults

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.results.Results<DocResult>
      • nl.inl.blacklab.search.results.DocResults
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<DocResult>, ResultGroups<Hit>, SearchResult

    public class DocResults
extends Results<DocResult>
implements ResultGroups<Hit>
    A list of DocResult objects (document-level query results).

        protected DocResults(QueryInfo queryInfo,
                     List<DocResult> results,
                     SampleParameters sampleParameters,
                     WindowStats windowStats)
        Wraps a list of DocResult objects with the DocResults interface. NOTE: the list is not copied but referenced! Used by DocGroups constructor.
        Parameters:
        queryInfo - query info
        results - the list of results
        windowStats - window stats

      • sort

        public <P extends ResultProperty<DocResult>> DocResults sort(P sortProp)
        Description copied from class: Results
        Return a new Results object with these results sorted by the given property. This keeps the existing sort (or lack of one) intact and allows you to cache different sorts of the same resultset. The result objects are reused between the two Results instances, so not too much additional memory is used.
        Specified by:
        sort in class Results<DocResult>
        Parameters:
        sortProp - the property to sort on
        Returns:
        a new Results object with the same results, sorted in the specified way

      • docsProcessedAtLeast

        public boolean docsProcessedAtLeast(int lowerBound)
        Determines if there are at least a certain number of results This may be used if we don't want to process all results (which may be a lot) but we do need to know something about the size of the result set (such as for paging).
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - the number we're testing against
        Returns:
        true if the size of this set is at least lowerBound, false otherwise.

      • docsProcessedSoFar

        public int docsProcessedSoFar()

      • docsProcessedTotal

        protected int docsProcessedTotal()
        Get the number of documents in this results set. Note that this returns the number of document results available; if there were so many hits that not all were retrieved (call maxHitsRetrieved()), you can find the grand total of documents by calling totalSize().
        Returns:
        the number of documents.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        index - the number of results we want to ensure have been read, or negative for all results

      • intSum

        public int intSum(ResultProperty<DocResult> numProp)
        Sum a property for all the documents. Can be used to calculate the total number of tokens in a subcorpus, for example. Note that this does retrieve all results, so it may be slow for large sets. In particular, you should try to call this method only for DocResults created with BlackLabIndex.queryDocuments() (and not ones created with Hits.perDocResults()) to avoid the overhead of fetching hits.
        Parameters:
        numProp - a numeric property to sum
        Returns:
        the sum

        Parameters:

      • doneProcessingAndCounting

        public boolean doneProcessingAndCounting()
        Description copied from class: Results
        Check if we're done retrieving/counting hits. If you're retrieving hits in a background thread, call this method from another thread to check if all hits have been processed.
        Specified by:
        doneProcessingAndCounting in class Results<DocResult>
        Returns:
        true iff all hits have been retrieved/counted.

      • getGroupMap

        public Map<PropertyValue,? extends Group<Hit>> getGroupMap()
        Specified by:
        getGroupMap in interface ResultGroups<Hit>

      • numberOfResultObjects

        public int numberOfResultObjects()
        Description copied from interface: SearchResult
        How many result objects does this search store? Used for estimating the cache size. Hits make up most of the storage of results objects, and they should take 24 bytes of memory, so we can use this number to make a reasonable approximation of memory usage. Note that this number can be misleading, because Hit objects are shared between results objects. But it's the best we have at the moment.
        Specified by:
        numberOfResultObjects in interface SearchResult
        Returns:
        how many hits are stored in this result object

      • tokensInMatchingDocs

        @Deprecated
public long tokensInMatchingDocs()
        Deprecated. use subcorpusSize().getTokens()
        Count total number of tokens in matching documents. This is fast if the query was created from a Query object (and the index contains DocValues), but slower if it was created from Hits or a list of DocResult objects.
        Returns:
        total number of tokens in matching documents.

      • subcorpusSize

        public CorpusSize subcorpusSize()
        Determine the size of the subcorpus defined by this set of documents. Counts number of documents and tokens. This is fast if the query was created from a Query object (and the index contains DocValues), but slower if it was created from Hits or a list of DocResult objects.
        Returns:
        subcorpus size

      • subcorpusSize

        public CorpusSize subcorpusSize(boolean countTokens)
        Determine the size of the subcorpus defined by this set of documents. Counts number of documents and tokens (if countTokens is true). This is fast if the query was created from a Query object (and the index contains DocValues), but slower if it was created from Hits or a list of DocResult objects.
        Parameters:
        countTokens - whether or not to count tokens (slower)
        Returns:
        subcorpus size

        public org.apache.lucene.search.Query query()
